Open Source

The character sheets are free and open source.

What does "open source" mean?

It means everything that makes this project work has been published. All the artwork, script files, source code and other ingredients are available for you to download.

It means that all this stuff has been released under a license that lets you change them and use them in new ways (provided you stick to a few simple rules).

It means you can contribute back to this project, and your work can be of benefit to others.

And it means that this project can continue even if I lose interest and take it away, as long as a copy survives somewhere.

GitHub

What can I do with them?

Anything covered by the license, including:

  • Changing invididual pages to fit the way you play
  • Making character sheets for new or variant classes that I haven't covered
  • Creating a new version of the whole project, with your changes, and making that available to other people
  • Converting the project to a different game

If you make useful changes, I encourage you to give them back to the community. Send me a message with your contact details, and if I like your work I'll incorporate it into the project. Even if I don't, you can still publish it on Paizo's forums or the web for others to see.

What can't I do?

You're not allowed to:

  • Pretend you made them yourself
  • Strip the OGL and other legal information out of the project
  • Anything not permitted by other publishers whose properties this project makes use of, including Wizards of the Coast and Paizo

What's to stop me stealing them?

Using the sheets as you like isn't stealing them, it's permitted and encouraged.

The only way you could “steal” the sheets is to plagiarise them - to claim that you made them yourself. Don't do that.

For more information, see the Legal Information page

Login

Patrons get the ability to edit all the fields, have calculations work automatically, and save character sheets. Login with Patreon to unlock these features:

Login with Patreon

Logging in will set a cookie on your PC. This does not contain any personally identifiable information, and will not be sent to any third party.

Become a patron

Support the site and gain access to extra features for just $1 by becoming a patron.
